text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/d881b516da0184052d2f9d33c3f72c5c014316bd|patch 8.2.0864: pragmas are indented all the way to the left>
patch 8.2.0864: pragmas are indented all the way to the left

Problem:    Pragmas are indented all the way to the left.
Solution:   Add an option to indent progmas like normal code. (Max Rumpf,
            closes #5468)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0864: pragmas are indented all the way to the left · vim/vim@d881b51
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0864: pragmas are indented all the way to the left · vim/vim@d881b51
attachments.text: Problem: Pragmas are indented all the way to the left. Solution: Add an option to indent progmas like normal code. (Max Rumpf, closes #5468)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/e35a52aee718c881bdfa69a47a1068df6ab6c60a|patch 8.2.0865: syntax foldlevel is taken from the start of the line>
patch 8.2.0865: syntax foldlevel is taken from the start of the line

Problem:    Syntax foldlevel is taken from the start of the line.
Solution:   Add ":syn foldlevel" to be able to use the minimal foldlevel in
            the line. (Brad King, closes #6087)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0865: syntax foldlevel is taken from the start of the line · vim/vim@e35a52a
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0865: syntax foldlevel is taken from the start of the line · vim/vim@e35a52a
attachments.text: Problem: Syntax foldlevel is taken from the start of the line. Solution: Add ":syn foldlevel" to be able to use the minimal foldlevel in the line. (Brad King, closes #6087)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/494e9069cb32620f7688a7cb128a3feff827639e|patch 8.2.0866: not enough tests for buffer writing>
patch 8.2.0866: not enough tests for buffer writing

Problem:    Not enough tests for buffer writing.
Solution:   Add more tests. Use CheckRunVimInTerminal in more places.
            (Yegappan Lakshmanan, closes #6167)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0866: not enough tests for buffer writing · vim/vim@494e906
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0866: not enough tests for buffer writing · vim/vim@494e906
attachments.text: Problem: Not enough tests for buffer writing. Solution: Add more tests. Use CheckRunVimInTerminal in more places. (Yegappan Lakshmanan, closes #6167)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/fccd93f0917234b962ce07d1df3adf9d7105936f|patch 8.2.0867: using \{xxx} for encoding a modifier is not nice>
patch 8.2.0867: using \{xxx} for encoding a modifier is not nice

Problem:    Using \{xxx} for encoding a modifier is not nice.
Solution:   Use \ instead, since it's the same as \ but producing a
            different code.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0867: using \{xxx} for encoding a modifier is not nice · vim/vim@fccd93f
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0867: using \{xxx} for encoding a modifier is not nice · vim/vim@fccd93f

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/2245ae18e3480057f98fc0e5d9f18091f32a5de0|patch 8.2.0868: trim() always trims both ends>
patch 8.2.0868: trim() always trims both ends

Problem:    trim() always trims both ends.
Solution:   Add an argument to only trim the beginning or end. (Yegappan
            Lakshmanan, closes #6126)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0868: trim() always trims both ends · vim/vim@2245ae1
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0868: trim() always trims both ends · vim/vim@2245ae1
attachments.text: Problem: trim() always trims both ends. Solution: Add an argument to only trim the beginning or end. (Yegappan Lakshmanan, closes #6126)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/858ba06d5f577b187da0367b231f7fa9461cb32d|patch 8.2.0869: it is not possible to customize the quickfix window c…>
patch 8.2.0869: it is not possible to customize the quickfix window contents

Problem:    It is not possible to customize the quickfix window contents.
Solution:   Add 'quickfixtextfunc'. (Yegappan Lakshmanan, closes #5465)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0869: it is not possible to customize the quickfix window c… · vim/vim@858ba06
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0869: it is not possible to customize the quickfix window c… · vim/vim@858ba06

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/ad772a63ec3bc86fe9d53cba783812f53470a313|patch 8.2.0870: MS-Windows: Control keys don't work in the GUI>
patch 8.2.0870: MS-Windows: Control keys don't work in the GUI

Problem:    MS-Windows: Control keys don't work in the GUI.
Solution:   Don't set seenModifyOtherKeys for now. (Yasuhiro Matsumoto,
            closes #6175)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0870: MS-Windows: Control keys don't work in the GUI · vim/vim@ad772a6
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0870: MS-Windows: Control keys don't work in the GUI · vim/vim@ad772a6
attachments.text: Problem: MS-Windows: Control keys don't work in the GUI. Solution: Don't set seenModifyOtherKeys for now. (Yasuhiro Matsumoto, closes #6175)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/f17e7ea67a798d0aa45ce24ea80c9e21d5164326|patch 8.2.0871: cannot use getmarklist() as a method>
patch 8.2.0871: cannot use getmarklist() as a method

Problem:    Cannot use getmarklist() as a method.
Solution:   Make getmarklist() work as a method.  Add one to the column
            number to match getpos(). (Yegappan Lakshmanan, closes #6176)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0871: cannot use getmarklist() as a method · vim/vim@f17e7ea
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0871: cannot use getmarklist() as a method · vim/vim@f17e7ea
attachments.text: Problem: Cannot use getmarklist() as a method. Solution: Make getmarklist() work as a method. Add one to the column number to match getpos(). (Yegappan Lakshmanan, closes #6176)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/f15c8b6eb32fcfea88fd9ca42ef87bbee2c8fe2b|patch 8.2.0872: XIM code is mixed with multi-byte code>
patch 8.2.0872: XIM code is mixed with multi-byte code

Problem:    XIM code is mixed with multi-byte code.
Solution:   Move the XIM code to a separate file. (Yegappan Lakshmanan,
            closes #6177)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0872: XIM code is mixed with multi-byte code · vim/vim@f15c8b6
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0872: XIM code is mixed with multi-byte code · vim/vim@f15c8b6
attachments.text: Problem: XIM code is mixed with multi-byte code. Solution: Move the XIM code to a separate file. (Yegappan Lakshmanan, closes #6177)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/2891459b81a21dbd2802ef1ae106c6680f085899|patch 8.2.0873: a .jl file can be sawfish (lisp) or Julia>
patch 8.2.0873: a .jl file can be sawfish (lisp) or Julia

Problem:    A .jl file can be sawfish (lisp) or Julia.
Solution:   Do not recognize *.jl as lisp, since it might be Julia.
            (closes #6178)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0873: a .jl file can be sawfish (lisp) or Julia · vim/vim@2891459
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0873: a .jl file can be sawfish (lisp) or Julia · vim/vim@2891459
attachments.text: Problem: A .jl file can be sawfish (lisp) or Julia. Solution: Do not recognize *.jl as lisp, since it might be Julia. (closes #6178)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/d14fd5285e491a39028c4b4722ddbe7c9dfa9bb2|patch 8.2.0874: signals test is a bit flaky>
patch 8.2.0874: signals test is a bit flaky

Problem:    Signals test is a bit flaky.
Solution:   Flush the XautoOut file.  Delete files that may be left behind
            from a failure. (Dominique Pelle, closes #6179)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0874: signals test is a bit flaky · vim/vim@d14fd52
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0874: signals test is a bit flaky · vim/vim@d14fd52
attachments.text: Problem: Signals test is a bit flaky. Solution: Flush the XautoOut file. Delete files that may be left behind from a failure. (Dominique Pelle, closes #6179)

patch 8.2.0875: getting attributes for directory entries is slow

Solution:   Add readdirex(). (Ken Takata, closes #5619)

patch 8.2.0876: :pwd does not give a hint about the scope of the directory

Solution:   Make ":verbose pwd" show the scope. (Takuya Fujiwara, closes #5469)
